My Story

Who I am at Work and Home

About Myself

I am a 23 year old student living in Vancouver and studying communications at KPU. I recently discovered a great love for programming, web development in particular, and have decided to shift my focus to becoming the best developer I can be. On this site you will find some details about my interests and hobbies, along with links to any work that I have deployed.

Hobbies and interests

What do I love to do

In my spare time I find myself pulled towards friends and family. I enjoy all kinds of social activities with them; these include, playing board games, hiking, hunting, volleyball, great conversation, and church activities. I also spend a large amount of my spare time teaching myself web development and working on making sites like this one. Lastly and most importantly, I spend my evenings talking to my fiance who lives in New Zealand. She is moving to Vancouver in late 2018, and we are both extremely excited.

Work Experience

E3 Eco Group

Currently I am employed part time at E3 Eco Group as an energy modeler. I work to profile new and old buildings in order to determine how energy efficient they are. The work is interesting and unique with no two jobs being exactly the same. I work mostly from home with only the occasional visit to the main office.

Languages and Technologies

What can I work with

The languages and technologies that I understand include: HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap 4, Sass, and JavaScript. I am constantly improving my abilities using websites such as Udemy and Lynda.com, along with YouTube tutorials, forum posts, experimentation and reading documentation. I am currently cementing my skills in JavaScript ES6+ syntax, and then I plan to begin learning React.js followed by Node.js. Long term I hope to be able to add Python, PHP, Angular, Materialize CSS, and many more to my list of skills.
